description: A walking tour of the City, visiting key areas associated with famous writers, from Shakespeare, Dr Johnson, Oscar Wilde, and many others.

factsheet.heading: Literary City walk
paragraphs: Discover the Square Mile’s literary legends, from Shakespeare to Oscar Wilde and beyond.

Step into the heart of London’s literary past with this guided walking tour for book lovers. Led by an expert City of London Green Badge guide, this 90 minute tour takes you through the streets of the Square Mile where some of history’s greatest writers lived, worked and found inspiration.

Discover where England’s publishing industry began, see where William Shakespeare wrote King Lear over lockdown and hear the gripping story of Oscar Wilde’s downfall following a scandalous court case.

You’ll also uncover the behind-the-scenes tales of the people who ensured Shakespeare’s plays survived for future generations and the romantic, bittersweet story of a priest poet who nearly lost everything for love.

Whether you're passionate about literature or curious about the City’s hidden history, this walking tour will open your eyes to the fascinating world of writers who left their indelible mark on London.
Please note: wear footwear suitable for a long walk around the City.

images.title: A guide outside Stationer's Hall. Image: Niki Gorick Photography

location.address: St MaryAldermary Garden, Love Lane, EC2P 2NQ

name: The Literary City
